channel.title: [Better than SRL] WidgetTalker (Undetectable)
channel.description:
Main thread on SRL-Forums (New Villu-Reborn) [url=http://www.srl-forums.com/forum/widgettalker-t9035.html]here[/url].
--
Well to bluntly bash on the SRL SendText, this is undetectable. SRL's SendText command uses SendKeys one letter at a time, and I don't know many people who have keyboards that magically go *poof* there's a letter. Just as well I don't know many people who can type !s without using shift.
This script (Written by me [Yes, I am Widget]) is a nice GUI (not just a form) and can support up to 20 lines to auto-type. Instead of F-Keys (You think they would notice F5, ooh he typed something!) It's a little button, a lot less suspicious.
Oh, and it types roughly 2½ times faster than the SRL one, just in case you hate everyone else's auto-talkers.
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v244/chaossliver/WidgetTalker1.png[/img]
- ChaosSliver/Widget

item.title: [Better than SRL] WidgetTalker (Undetectable)
item.dc:creator: @Lorax Lorax
item.description:
@Lorax wrote:

Is this a challenge?
I think SRL has a procedure that uses shift… i’m pretty sure…
also you must remember that the people who makes auto-talkers are not the Developers
I would in no way say that it’s better than SRL, but it might be better than the current auto talkers at SRL

Read full topic

item.title: [Better than SRL] WidgetTalker (Undetectable)
item.dc:creator: @ChaosSliver Widget
item.description:
@ChaosSliver wrote:

Main thread on SRL-Forums (New Villu-Reborn) here.

–

Well to bluntly bash on the SRL SendText, this is undetectable. SRL’s SendText command uses SendKeys one letter at a time, and I don’t know many people who have keyboards that magically go poof there’s a letter. Just as well I don’t know many people who can type !s without using shift.

This script (Written by me [Yes, I am Widget]) is a nice GUI (not just a form) and can support up to 20 lines to auto-type. Instead of F-Keys (You think they would notice F5, ooh he typed something!) It’s a little button, a lot less suspicious.

Oh, and it types roughly 2½ times faster than the SRL one, just in case you hate everyone else’s auto-talkers.
